profileAlternative.name: Michael Lynn
profileAlternative.headline: My primary purpose is to help others.
profileAlternative.summary: International Conference Speaker, Presenter, Software Engineer and Developer Advocate. Primary objectives include increasing awareness and enabling developers through code, blogging content and community engagement.

aboutAlternative.text: International Conference Speaker, Presenter, Software Engineer and Developer Advocate. Primary objectives include increasing awareness and enabling developers through code, blogging content and community engagement.

positions.title: MongoDB
positions.description:
- Help to build and nurture the startup community through the MongoDB for Startups accelerator program, an initiative designed to help startups succeed by offering access to the software and services to help them build and scale their business.
- Mentor and advise startups and founders on the technical aspects of their products.
- Manage the Startups Technical Advisors program - a volunteer-based initiative which pairs startup founders and developers with experts to help solve their technical challenges.
- Teach, enable, mentor, nurture, build and train through content, conference speaking, screencasts and curriculum.

positions.title:
Title
Director, Principal Developer Advocate
positions.description:
- Help to build and nurture the startup community through the MongoDB for Startups accelerator program, an initiative designed to help startups succeed by offering access to the software and services to help them build and scale their business.
- Mentor and advise startups and founders on the technical aspects of their products.
- Manage the Startups Technical Advisors program - a volunteer-based initiative which pairs startup founders and developers with experts to help solve their technical challenges.
- Teach, enable, mentor, nurture, build and train through content, conference speaking, screencasts and curriculum.

positions.title:
Title
Co-Organizer - MongoDB Community User Group (PhillyMUG)
positions.description: My mission is to build and drive increased awareness of MongoDB's Database Platform and tools and related NoSQL technologies in and around the Philadelphia Area. I accomplish this primarily by building monthly Meetup sessions, identifying speakers and/or building and delivering presentations.

positions.title:
Title
Sr. Solutions Architect
positions.description:
Responsible for guiding and informing customers and users throughout the process of designing and building reliable, scalable systems using MongoDB.

* Design systems, applications, and infrastructure to help drive some of the world's largest software development projects leveraging MongoDB

* Advise customers on architectures, patterns, and strategies for making best use of MongoDB

* Partner with our sales team to help ensure success in accounts ranging from small startups to large enterprises

* Lead proof of concept implementations from concept through execution

* Translate technical concepts and patterns into business benefits for management and executives

* Work with the enablement team to produce and deliver content to educate newly hired MongoDB team members.

* Curate, develop and deliver field enablement and education content to train MongoDB employees and keep them informed on the technical aspects of the products and services MongoDB provides.
…
see more

positions.title: Medallia, Inc.
positions.description:
Medallia makes software to measure and improve the customer experience in real time. We allow businesses to listen to, understand, and then act on their customers' feedback.

What does this mean? Think about the last interaction you had with a business. Was it a good one? Could it have been better? As a customer in this scenario, these questions may seem obvious. But here's the thing — they're not obvious to most businesses. A lot of them don't know whether the interaction you just had was a good one or not, and if they do know, who's held accountable for improving it in the future.

Medallia solves this. Our software lets businesses answer these questions — helping them to become companies that their customers love.

We've come a long way since being founded in Silicon Valley in 2001. Our product is powering some of the largest and most customer-centric organizations in the world. We're backed by Sequoia Capital, the world's pre-eminent venture capital firm. With offices in Palo Alto, London and Buenos Aires, we've got lots of smart, fun and interesting people working here.

In fact, there's only one thing we're really missing:

You.

So check us out, and if the problems we're tackling sound interesting to you… let's talk!
…
see more

positions.title:
Title
Business Development Solutions Consultant
positions.description:
- Driving strategy and execution of Medallia's referral, resell and service delivery partnerships
- Developing product integration, business models and sales enablement plans with partner firms
- Developing custom solutions and demonstrations in line with a variety of verticals, industries and business problems.

positions.title: BMC Software
positions.description: Provide direction, leadership, and focus to a team of Pre-Sales Software Consultants to enable and support the enterprise sales and account management teams. Identify and develop opportunities, guide product development and assist in technical marketing cycles.

positions.title:
Title
Pre-Sales Software Consulting Manager
positions.description: Provide direction, leadership, and focus to a team of Pre-Sales Software Consultants to enable and support the enterprise sales and account management teams. Identify and develop opportunities, guide product development and assist in technical marketing cycles.

positions.title:
Title
Senior Software Consultant
positions.description: My primary mission is to explain, demonstrate and prove the value of server automation and cloud computing using a wide array of software solutions designed to bridge the gap between business and IT.

positions.title: Engineer Consultant
positions.description:
• Created automated firmware / bios update utility based on PXE/TFTP used to improve efficiency of deploying hardware firmware updates.
• Created suite of tools (Bash/Perl) to facilitate server inventory data capture and analysis in support of SAS70 and other audit requirements.
• Initiated proof of concept and vendor product evaluation for IP Address Management (IPAM) – Created an evaluation framework to capture requirements, test criteria and ultimately provide the necessary data to facilitate a product decision.
• Maintained primary responsibility for external DNS maintenance all TD Ameritrade and affiliated brands.
• Created various utility tools and scripts for use by the engineering team written in Javascript - ExtJS, PHP, and Perl.
• Created custom suite of tools to manage and control redirection of incoming site visitors of the primary external marketing site to customized versions of content based on browser / device type.
• Assisted in planning and successful implementation of large-scale, multi-phased data center migration.
• Implemented a new system for incident and problem management utilizing Atlassian Jira integrated with email.
…
see more

positions.title: Engineering Manager
positions.description:
• Responsible for a team of engineers primarily engaged in System Design; definition and documentation of the hardware, software, infrastructure components, modules, interfaces, scalability and availability solutions to meet business development requirements.
- Responsible for Application Integration; the process of building solutions based on the system design and the standard Merrill Lynch product portfolio; deployment documentation, knowledge sharing, and training of support staff to ensure proper operational implementation.
- Responsible for Infrastructure Integration; the process of bringing together the infrastructure components to form a cohesive framework to support end-to-end business solutions.
- Responsible for 3rd level Support; incident troubleshooting, analysis, resolution and documentation beyond 1st, and 2nd level operational support.
- In addition to team leadership, development and coaching, daily activities include scripting, system administration, software development and packaging, interface with Level 1, 2 and 3 Systems Administration staff to ensure adherence to incident, change, release and problem management procedures; interface with application development teams to ensure consistent, supportable architectures; develop and design infrastructure architectures.
- Developed Server Visibility Tool – a tool used to facilitate inventory and maintenance of a 2500 server inventory consisting of a front-end (ExtJS, JavaScript, PHP), data gathering scripts (Perl), and a database (MySQL).
- Created and documented test plans and architecture design proposals for Global Wealth Management Applications including Falcon Financial Management, Portfolio Management and Accounting System and others.
- Work as division lead for Data Center Migration issues related to UNIX/Linux Platform.
…
see more

given.text:
Michael's direct influence on me was until 2005, but the impressions he made have lasted until today. Michael is the choice of technologists - possessing intricate knowledge of so many aspects of our ever expanding field, and following with design and execution second to none. If I had but ten of Michael Lynn, I could rule the world!
…
See more

Mike is a conscientious, enthusiastic and thorough individual who doesn't let any obstacle prevent him from accomplishing the task and bringing success to the customer, whether by administration, coding or configuration.

Michael has the ability to quickly synthesize new technologies and concepts - and understand them better than many so-called experts. He can quickly move from critiquing a high level concept to implementation details. It is refreshing to work with somebody who can distill a complex situation into the key points. I highly recommend him and his work.
…
See more

Michael is a study in intensity. He is focused and direct. When he learns something, he learns it well and often takes that something to the next level. He accomplishes many things through a willingness to work hard and yet be patient as he moves through a task to get it right. He is rarely satisfied with "good enough", which is a trait that I greatly respect. Michael is thoughtful and courteous to those around him regardless of their position in relation to his. He works well as either a team player or an independent person in a project. I have rarely seen him dismiss an idea out of hand. He has the ability to see the nugget of worth in the pile of rock and dirt of any thought or process. Michael's ability to see the value in people and ideas, his work ethic and his willingness to think outside the box are traits that will serve him, and those around him well.
…
See more

received.text: Tushar is a force... he's a triple threat: Massively smart, great communicator and an awesome people person.  He's also got an amazing capability to understand deep technical issues and can easily tailor communication and planning to address real business need.  I thoroughly enjoyed my time working with him at Medallia and would absolutely, without hesitation recommend him for a technical leadership position in the future.

Matt and I worked together during a proof of concept exercise.  Matt's attention to detail, knowledge of his organizational ecosystem and his work ethic combine to make him an absolute A player.  He has a terrific grasp of the automation technology landscape as well as the operational knowledge and experience to understand requirements for implementation.   I'd put Matt in the category "hire - even if you don't have an immediate position."
